judges: Before Jones, C. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nin and ManDERINO, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Pee Curiam,
The judgment of sentence which imposed the death penalty is vacated. Judgment of sentence imposing imprisonment for life is hereby entered.
opinions.author: Pee Curiam,

attorneys: Stephen M. Feldman, with him Robert E. Lenton and Feldman & Feldman, for appellant.

Edward G. Rendell, Assistant District Attorney, with him Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Crawford, Deputy District Attorney, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Mount, Appellant.
Argued November 27, 1972.
Before Jones, C. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nin and ManDERINO, JJ.
Stephen M. Feldman, with him Robert E. Lenton and Feldman & Feldman, for appellant.
Edward G. Rendell, Assistant District Attorney, with him Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Crawford, Deputy District Attorney, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
January 19, 1973:
